basics.name: Patrick Stanger
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a lifelong learner, DIYer, taker-aparter, and problem-solver. For six years I've been using my powers for good as a fullstack software engineer in the SF Bay Area, taking ownership of complex problems and delivering them under rigid deadlines

highlights: Supported an extended dynamic hardware/firmware development process, often with changing requirements and under tight timelines
Designed and built multi-platform R&D tool, enabling the capture, storage, and visualization of clinical trial data
Devised statistical algorithm and training tool that is essential to core device functionality
Developed a series of calibration and testing applications that gives stakeholders confidence in the quality of every device sold
Bootstrapped integration CI testing suite in CircleCI, Cypress, and Golang, bolstering confidence in our rapidly developing application
Refactored and denormalized client Redux data store, reducing some page load times in half
Created data model and ingestion tooling to handle annually updated government pricing process
Constructed real-time analytics dashboard using Django to provide insights into multibillion-dollar government program
Built a web admin portal and BaaS data model to support a mobile task distribution application
Held lectures on problem solving and performed one-on-one interview prep

skills.name: Infrastructure
keywords: AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, ECS, EMR)
